subclusters.subcluster_name: Dietary Restriction and Calorie Restriction Theories
Evolutionary Disposable Soma and Life-History Trade-off Theories

theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on the insulin/IGF-1 signaling network as a central regulator of aging, growth, and metabolism, fitting well with other IIS pathway-centered theories.
Describes the role of insulin/IGF-1 signaling in longevity and protein homeostasis, aligning with IIS pathway mechanisms.
Focuses on IRS-2 as a key adaptor in insulin signaling affecting lifespan, clearly part of the IIS signaling theme.
Describes insulin receptor and TOR signaling in cardiac aging, part of IIS and related nutrient sensing pathways.
Focuses on IIS regulation of longevity via DAF-16/FOXO and SMK-1 modulation, a core IIS mechanism.
Describes IIS regulation of lifespan via DAF-16/FOXO in C. elegans, fitting IIS pathway cluster.
Focuses on insulin/IGF signaling in Drosophila lifespan and reproduction, part of IIS signaling mechanisms.
MYC-mediated regulation of IGF1 signaling modulates aging, linking to IIS and mTOR pathways.
Describes IIS reduction effects on longevity and stress resistance via DAF-16 and metabolic shifts, core IIS theme.
IGF-1 signaling modulation by dietary restriction affecting aging, fits IIS signaling cluster.
Focuses on DAF-16/FOXO regulation by IIS and germline ablation, part of IIS longevity mechanisms.
IIS pathway regulation of aging and downstream effectors Sirt1 and Foxo3a, fits IIS cluster.
IIS regulation of lifespan and cognitive aging via DAF-16/FOXO, part of IIS signaling mechanisms.
IIS modulation delays aging and neurodegenerative disease progression, fits IIS signaling cluster.
IIS regulation of longevity via FoxO transcription factors, core IIS signaling mechanism.
IIS pathway and FOXO1 regulation of lifespan, fits IIS signaling cluster.
Focuses on energetic and metabolic pathways including AMPK, mTOR, sirtuins, and IIS as central to aging and resilience.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Calorie restriction extends lifespan and reduces chronic disease risk, core dietary restriction mechanism.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Classic disposable soma theory emphasizing evolutionary trade-offs between reproduction and maintenance.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Life-history trade-off theory focusing on reproduction-lifespan resource allocation, fits evolutionary disposable soma theme.
